page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content: RAIL The Preston-Blackpool railway runs through the N.E. corner of the block with the Salwick station on the northern boundary. Once a regular stopping-place, the only stopping now is a twice-daily goods service to and from B.N.F.L. VEHICULAR There is a regular bus service between Preston and Blackpool. There is an average of 3 buses per hour each way between 08.00 and 21.30 hours daily, except for Sundays when the services are halved. Over 90% of people have cars. CANALS The Preston-Lancaster canal runs through the extreme N.E. corner of the block; it is used for leisure now.
